Uses of Class
edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.exceptions.WapException

  • Packages that use WapException 
    Package Description
    edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.controller
    Contains controllers that implement the the REST endpoints along with utility classes containing constants.
    edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.exceptions
    Contains all Exceptions
    edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model
    Contains the common model interfaces and general model constants
    edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.rdf
    Contains the Apache RDF implementation of the common model interfaces and some utility classes
    edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.repository.jena
    Contains the Apache Jena specific implementations of the repositories and the Jena RDF backend.
    edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service
    Contains the the service interfaces and implementations which are used as the bridge between the controllers and the repositories.

    • Uses of WapException in edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.exceptions

      Subclasses of WapException in edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.exceptions 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ContainerNotEmptyException
      This exception is used whenever a container that has subcontainers should be deleted
      class  EtagDoesntMatchException
      This exception is used when ETags do not match in the request and the database
      class  FormatException
      This exception is used for various types of exceptions related to format processing.
      class  FormatNotAvailableException
      This exception is used if during post/post requests an invalid format is used.
      class  HttpHeaderException
      This exception is used for all problems concerning HTTP header fields.
      class  IllegalHttpParameterException
      This exception is used whenever HTTP requests contained illegal parameters in their query string.
      class  IllegalPageIriException
      This exception is used when the IRI of a page has an invalid form
      class  InternalServerException
      This exception is used for internal server errors that are already specific enough using the message alone
      class  InvalidContainerException
      This exception is used if the client tries to create a container that is not a LDP basic container, has an invalid name or similar container specific reasons
      class  InvalidRequestException
      This exception is used whenever a per se valid HTTP Method is used on a resource in an invalid way not already implemented by more specific exceptions
      class  MethodNotAllowedException
      This exception is used whenever a HTTP Method is used on a resource where it is not allowed like posting to a Page.
      class  NotAContainerException
      This exception is used when the body of a PUT/POST request does not contain a valid Container
      class  NotAnAnnotationException
      This exception is used when the body of a PUT/POST request does not contain a valid Annotation
      class  NotExistentException
      This exception is used when a requested resource does not exist
      class  RepositoryException
      This exception is used whenever an error occurred in the repository
      class  ResourceDeletedException
      This exception is used whenever a resource that has been deleted should be recreated
      class  ResourceExistsException
      This exception is used whenever a resource that already exists should be created
      class  UnallowedPropertyChangeException
      This exception is used when properties that are forbidden to change are tried to be changed
